pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:0.5_0: The second training rule on swaying the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.13_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.16_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and leaning their bodies while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.4_0: he should not sway his body while sitting in inhabited areas;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.5_0: one should sit keeping one’s body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk16:1.6_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and leans his body while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
